client_profile: Couple buying an apartment in Brussels. Budget EUR 490k-895k. Priorities: quiet residential streets, 15-minute access to green parks, and walkable cafes and brunch spots.
must_have: Balcony or terrace 6+ sqm with sunlight.
EPC rating C or better with recent certificate.
Quiet street or rear-facing bedrooms away from bars.
nice_to_have: 15-minute walk to a large park like Parc Tenbosch.
Cafes and brunch spots within a 10-minute walk.
South or west-facing living room for light.
red_flags: EPC rating E or worse with no costed renovation plan.
Single-glazed street-facing windows on tram routes.
Visible damp or mold in cellar or bathroom areas.
Unclear ownership or leasehold terms instead of full freehold.
Pending facade or roof works without approved budget.
contradictions: Quiet side streets may reduce immediate cafe options.
Top-floor charm can conflict with elevator requirement.
Large terrace can push price above budget.
Newer energy-efficient builds may be outside historic cores.

top_districts.name: Ixelles (Ixelles - Chatelain Tenbosch)
why: Around Parc Tenbosch, tree-lined streets mix boutiques and brunch spots with surprisingly quiet courtyards.
Tram 8 at Bailli connects quickly to Louise and EU stops while keeping commutes simple.
watch_out: Prices near Place du Chatelain can stretch budgets, and parking permits are competitive.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
why: Near Parc de Woluwe, low-traffic avenues offer greenery, jogging paths, and calm residential living.
Stockel metro at Stockel Station brings fast links, with cafes clustered on nearby streets.
watch_out: Commutes into the center can be longer, and some areas lack late-night options.

top_districts.name: Uccle
why: Around Wolvendael Park, residential streets feel village-like, with bakeries and brunch spots nearby.
Tram 4 at Heros links to the center, keeping travel simple without heavy traffic.
watch_out: Street gradients can be steep, and parking is difficult near Uccle Centre on weekends.

questions_for_agent_landlord: What is the all-in acquisition cost estimate including fees, taxes, and notary?
Are title, urban planning use, and permits fully compliant with no infractions?
What are monthly co-ownership charges and any voted or planned works with budgets?
What is the condition of roof, facade, plumbing, and electrics per recent inspections?
What timeline do sellers prefer, and how flexible is price for negotiation?
next_steps: Secure mortgage pre-approval and buyer costs estimate with notary.
Shortlist 6-8 streets per district using maps and noise data.
Book first 6 viewings and request syndic minutes and EPC reports.
Arrange surveyor for structural check and utilities inspection before offering.
clarifying_questions: Do you need a private parking space or is street parking acceptable?
Which floors are acceptable if there is no elevator above second floor?
What is your target move-in month and renovation tolerance in weeks and budget?
action_plan: Confirm your top-3 areas by visiting 2 micro-anchors in each (day + evening).
Confirm full purchase budget: taxes, notary, agency fees, renovation buffer, and monthly charges.
Line up a trusted notary/agent and define your offer terms (conditions, timeline, financing).
Ask the agent/landlord the 5 essentials below and request written answers.
